alert.note: Alert for Lee; Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 1:12PM EDT until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Bamberg, Calhoun, Clarendon, Lee, Orangeburg and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 112 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sumter, Orangeburg, Manning, Bishopville, South Sumter, Brookdale, Holly Hill, Branchville, Summerton, Bowman, Elloree, Santee State Park, Poinsett State Park, Alcolu, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Millwood, Mulberry, Sumter County Airport, Claflin College and South Carolina State University. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 146. Interstate 26 between mile markers 145 and 169. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 116 and 126. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
